info.title: DynaMed
info.description: MedsAPI DynaMed provides endpoints to search and retrieve current and accurate evidence-based content. The documentation on this site covers all supported functionality of the MedsAPI suite of APIs. Any fields or parameters not represented by the documentation are unsupported and subject to change. Additional optional query parameters and fields in the response could be added in the future as a non breaking change. Any other change that could break the contract would be considered in a future version.

refresh_token_expires_in.description: The number of seconds remaining before the refresh token will expire.  The lifespan of refresh tokens is usually larger than Access tokens. The exact duration depends on the type of Refresh Tokens issued. The different types explained below in the document.

developer.email.description: Name of the owener of the token

token_type.description: Always set to be a bearer token

issued_at.description: Epoch time when the token was issued

client_id.description: Client Id that the token can be used by

application_name.description: Id of the application that is registered for this token

expires_in.description: Seconds until this token has expired

refresh_count.description: When this token can be refreshed automatically

status.description: Indicates that the token has been approved

401.description: Unauthorized - This request requires authentication and none was provided.

403.description: Forbidden - The authentication credentials do not have access to this resource.

404.description: Not Found - The server was unable to find a resource matching this request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The server has not implemented the requested HTTP method.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The server cannot return the requested media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server cannot understand the media type in this request.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The client has sent too many requests within the given time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - There was an unexpected error with the server

client_id.description: The client_id to use will be provided by EBSCO

client_secret.description: This will be provided by EBSCO

post.description: The authentication endpoint for getting a token, used in all other DynaMed APIs.

get.summary: Get content matching one or more query terms
get.description:
The Search endpoint returns items matching the caller's query with
summary information. Aggregations are included for all publication types that
have been specified.

parameters.name: queryLanguage
parameters.description: Two letter language code to translate the query from.

parameters.name: pubTypeId
parameters.description:
Comma separated publication types to return. These values are
discovered through the ''medsapi-dynamed/v1/pubtypes'' endpoint.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page of results to start from. Each page contains 10 items.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
Used for paginated search result.Returned in the first page of
results.

get.summary: Get titles and/or terms as suggestions matching the supplied query
get.description:
The Search Suggestions endpoint returns suggestions matching the
caller's query with summary information. Aggregations are included for all
publication types that have been specified.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: String of characters to search for suggestions.

parameters.name: suggestionType
parameters.description: A comma separated list of supported ('title' and 'term') suggestion types.

parameters.name: queryLanguage
parameters.description: ISO 639.2 alpha-3 B language code. Defaults to 'eng'

parameters.name: maxItemsPerSuggestionType
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return for each suggestion type, defaults to 10

get.summary: Get resource classification for the content
get.description:
The Pubtypes endpoint returns a list of publication types which
are used in conjunction with the search endpoint to perform a search query.

get.summary: Get a paginated list of categories available for DynaMed content
get.description:
The Categories endpoint returns a paginated list of categories
available for DynaMed content.

initiatedBy.description: One of: typed-in, paging or didyoumean-probe

pageToken.description: Must use for continuing the search when paging

searchTime.description: Time in ms to execute search

queryUsed.description: Term used by the search engine

page.description: Start of next page of items to return

field.description:
Indicates how many and what publication types each
search match would fall into.

query.description:
Term(s) that were specified, in the original language
not corrected for typos

request.description:
Contains all of the query parameters exactly as specified
by the caller.

items.description:
Provide paging links for getting next, previous and related
link information.

Format for all but image results. See Models section below
for image item details

search_response.description:
Search results have 2 forms for the items.  This section describes
the response for all but image items.  See the Search API supplemental documentation
for details on the items.

description.example:
Carcinoid heart disease refers to cardiac manifestations of advanced
carcinoid tumors and carcinoid syndrome.

title.example: Ultrasound in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU)

queryUsed.description: Term used by the search engine

totalItems.description: Total number of items matching the query

field.description:
Indicates how many and what publication types each
search match would fall into.

title.description: Name of the title along with the count of items returned by the search suggestion

term.description: Name of the term along with the count of items returned by the search suggestion

query.description: Term(s) that were specified, in the original language not corrected for typos

suggestionType.description: Type for the list of search results

completedPhrase.description:
Title of the article from DynaMed that matched
the search criteria

start.description:
The location of the matched query term in
the matched resource

length.description: The length of the matched term in the resource

href.description:
Self link to fetch the content of the
article

totalItems.description: Total number of resources accessible through this request.

links.description: Hypermedia links for this resource collection.

rel.description: Relation type of the coresponding href value.

href.description: Absolute link pointing to related resource.

items.description: An array containing the current page of publication types.

id.description: The unique identifier for this publication type.

toc.description: Table of contents for this article

title.description: Title of the section, e.g., `Zika Virus Infection`

anchor.description: The anchor location of the section
The anchor location of the subsection.
The anchor location of the section.

copyright.example: Courtesy of The JAMA Network® ©American Medical Association

description.example:
The main plot shows survival probability during the first
90 days, and the inset shows survival probability over the full
observational period. Survival analysis was based on cardiac arrests
that occurred between January 1, 2009, and October 2, 2011. Mortality
was observed until December 31, 2011, when the data were censored;
thus, there was follow-up to at least 90 days for each beneficiary.
ALS indicates advanced life support; BLS, basic life support.

contentLocations.description: array of locations for this image

anchor.description: The anchor of this image in the parent
the anchor of the containing content

content.example: • Subbiah R, Gula LJ, Klein GJ, et al. Workup of the cardiac arrest survivor: for the symposium on sudden cardiac death for progress in cardiovascular diseases. Prog Cardiovasc Dis. 2008 Nov-Dec;51(3):195-203

consensusDetails.description: an array of consensus details for the article

anchor.description: the anchor of this consensus detail

noteContent.example: Content referenced with “Consensus” in Hospitalist Focused Content is supported by a combination of the best available evidence and expert opinion put forth by a panel of Hospitalists.

panelContent.example:
Panel participants:

  • Vijay Duggirala, MD: Clinical Assistant Professor, The Ohio State University College of Nursing; Clinical Assistant Professor, The Ohio State University College of Medicine; Hospitalist, Director of Consult Services and Director of Quality & Patient Safety, Division of Hospital Medicine, The Ohio State Wexner Medical Center; Ohio, United States
  • Dr. Duggirala declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Chi Huang, MD: Executive Medical Director of General Medicine and Hospital Medicine Shared Services, Wake Forest Baptist Health System; Section Chief, Hospital Medicine, Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center; Associate Professor of Internal Medicine, Wake Forest Medical School; North Carolina, United States
  • Dr. Huang declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Richard Rothman, MD: Chair and Physician Advisor, Department of Hospital Medicine, Cleveland Clinic India River Hospital; Florida, United States
  • Dr. Rothman declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Andrés J. Solorza, MD: Assistant Clinical Professor, Tufts University; Chair-Person, Department of Hospital Medicine, Lahey Hospital and Medical Center; Massachusetts, United States
  • Dr. Solorza declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Nestor G. Tarragona, MD, FHM, FACP: Assistant Professor of Medicine, Tufts University School of Medicine; Vice Chairperson, Division of Hospital Medicine, Lahey Hospital and Medical Center; Medical Director for Latin America, Teladoc Health; Massachusetts, United States
  • Dr. Tarragona declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.
  • Yoania Quintana-Garcia, MD: Hospitalist, Cleveland Clinic Indian River Hospital; Florida, United States
  • Dr. Quintana-Garcia declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.

slug.description:
Complete slug of the article, e.g., `/condition/zika-virus-infection`.
The complete slug is made of the pubType ID, (`condition`) and the title
(`zika-virus-infection`)

title.description: Title of the article, e.g., `Zika Virus Infection`

content.example:
Related Summaries

  • Ventricular fibrillation
  • Sudden cardiac death
  • Ventricular tachycardia – approach to the patient
  • Advanced cardiovascular life support (ACLS)
  • Adult basic life support (BLS)
  • Immediate post-cardiac arrest care
  • Therapeutic hypothermia for neuroprotection following cardiac arrest
  • Implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD)
  • ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI)
  • Acute coronary syndromes
  • Coronary artery disease (CAD)

pubType.description: array of pub types for this article

text.example:
initial shockable rhythm, witnessed arrest, monitored arrest,
and arrest during daytime hours each associated with increased in-hospital
or survival within 30 days in patients with in-hospital cardiac
arrest (BMJ 2019 Dec 4)

practiceChangingUpdate.description: is this a practice changing update?

anchor.description: the anchor location relevant to this update

conflictsText.description: description of any conflicts of interest
conflictsText.example: Dr. Lang declares no relevant financial conflicts of interest.

affiliationText.example:
Zone Clinical and Academic Department Head for Emergency
Medicine and Professor of Emergency Medicine, University of Calgary;
Alberta, Canada; Senior Researcher, Alberta Health Services; Alberta,
Canada

totalItems.description: Total number of items that are returned

id.description: ID used to retrieve the topic

rel.description: Self link and links to all categories
